sub_topic: Determining the diameter of a graph.
message_1: Let's say we have a graph with 10 vertices, and it is known that the shortest path between any two vertices is no more than 4 edges long. What is the diameter of the graph?
message_2: The diameter of a graph is the length of the longest shortest path between any two vertices in the graph. Since it is given that the shortest path between any two vertices is no more than 4 edges long, the diameter of the graph is 4.
